page.title: 01Holt Heath Nature Reserve
page.content: At one time in the last century much of the land in S.E.Dorset was heathland,in our own century the heathland has come under pressure for other uses of the land,for improved pasture,forestry and housing.Much of this once large area has become fragmented,these areas in turn have come under pressure from neighbouring land users.To conserve as many of these larger fragments before they are lost groups like the Dorset Naturalist Trust,National Trust and Nature Conservancy Council have been trying to conserve such sites The N.C.C. purchased the Holt Heath site in 1981 and it is at present managed by a part time warden,who with volunteer workers is doing much to manage the site.Much of the S.portion of the site lies out of this survey area,this block N. of Bull Burrow & Holt Forest.
